definition: to parade (a prisoner) through the streets
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: The criminals were paraded in chains through the crowded streets.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯带着镣铐被押着列队游街示众。

sentences.english: The captured criminals were paraded through the streets.
sentences.chinese: 抓获的罪犯被游街示众。

sentences.english: The captured criminals were paraded through the main streets.
sentences.chinese: 被抓获的犯人列队游街示众。

definition: to parade sb through the streets/to march or parade in the streets
to behead sb and display the head in public
to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
to execute by firing squad/to shoot dead/fig. to discard/to get rid of
to execute by firing squad/same as 槍斃|枪毙
to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
an execution/to put sb to death
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
